result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A. Benavides was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: This sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentences in 14CF414 & 15CF94

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug urinalysis (at least once per month for first 6 months upon release from jail/prison; thereafter per agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by agent
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No Contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate
--No Contact with Rachel Zehnder
--Provide DNA sample upon demand to designee 

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
[Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Cases 14CF414, 15CF72, and 15CF94 called together at 2:33pm [mo]
Defendant Jose A. Benavides in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court amends 15CF94 Count #1 to Theft from a Person, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e).

As to Case 15CF72:
Mr. Benavides waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--Atty. Fischer waives any jurisdictional defects and time limitations that may have occurred since a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment did not occur at an earlier date.


Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Case 14CF414 Count #1, 15CF72 Count #1 and Case 15CF94 Amended Count #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Benavides  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts. 

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Fischer
Statement made by Mr. Benavides

As to Case 14CF414 Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Benavides  to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of    12   months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.   

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
As to Case 15CF72 Count #1: 
The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Benavides on Probation for 12months. This is to be served consecutive to the sentences in 14CF414 and 15CF94 


As to Case 15CF94 Count#1:
The Court sentences Mr. Benavides  to 3   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   12    months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be consecutive to the sentence in Case 14CF414
As to Case 15CF94 Count#2
The Court sentences Mr. Benavides  to   3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   12    months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be consecutive to the sentence in Case 14CF414; concurrent to Case 15CF94 Count #1 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
----Mr. Benavides can request CIP/SAP on this file only after service of Initial Confinement in Case 14CF414


The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision and Probation on all Cases:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--
random drug urinalysis (at least once per month for first 6 months upon release from jail/prison; thereafter per agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by agent
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No Contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate
--No Contact with Rachel Zehnder
--Provide DNA sample upon demand to designee 
--As to Case 14CF414: 100 hours of community service
--As to Case 14CF414 Count #1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
 plus $65 summons fee plus $175 drug testing fee
--As to Case 15CF72 Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF94 Count#1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF94 Count#2:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


On Case 14CF414:The Court gives  50 days credit for time already served.
On Case 15CF72: The Court gives  1 day credit for time already served.
On Case 15CF94: The Court gives 14 days credit for time already served. 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

recess:3:40pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling notice

Cases 14CF414, 15CF72 & 15CF94 called together at 10:05 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Jose A. Benavides in court, in-custody, with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer requests matter for plea/sentencing, are very close to resolution
Recess: 10:06 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 6/5/15 at 1:30 pm
Status conference on May 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Bond covers 14CF414 & 15CF72
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF94, 14CF414 and 15CF72 called at 9:15am [mo]
Defendant Jose A. Benavides in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Fischer .   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF94:
The Court addresses substitution of counsel: Attorney Y. Zarwell is present in the gallery and she indicates that she has no objection to the proposed substitution.  In response to the Court's inquiry, Mr. Benavides indicates he wishes to be represented by Atty. Fischer. The Court grants the substitution of counsel.

Mr. Benavides  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

As to case 14CF414 and 15CF72:
As to the State's 4/17/15 Motion to Modify Bond:
--The State asks for $5000 cash bond across both files.
--The Court will not order forfeiture of the $1,000 cash amount that was previously posted.  This $1,000 amount is to be refunded to the Surety.
--The Court amends the Bond to be a $5,000 Cash Bond which applies to both files. 
--In response to the clerk's inquiry, the Court indicates that while there are separate Bonds-- the $5,000 Cash Bond in Case #15CF94, and then this newly ordered $5,000 Cash Bond that applies to Case #14CF414 and #15CF72--the Court is only requiring the posting of a single $5,000 amount.
--The Court indicates to Mr. Benavides that the previously imposed bond conditions remain in effect. 
recess: 9:26am 


NEXT:  (1) PTC: April 22, 2015 at 3:00pm  (2) STC on all three cases: May 15,2015 at 9:30am
Motion hearing on April 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States notice of motion and motion for bond modification

Probable Cause Statement

case called at 1:34-pm. [mo]
Defendant Jose A. Benavides appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody with Attorney Fischer.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court verifies name, date of birth, and address,

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all medications as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, including needles
recess 1:39  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference :4/1/15 at 8:20am   (2) Status Conference: 4/17/15 at 11:00am
